reviews.sentence: Pros. Freshly baked cookies upon check in. Our room was really nice. It was clean and really stylish. Comfortable bed we loved the down. Complimentary bowl of fruit and a card as a surprise for our 5th anniversary. That was really thoughtful. The location is right near the wharf. Perfect if you are going out to dinner. it is also an ideal location for whale watching super early. You can grab Starbucks right nearby and walk on over. Cafe Treiste is also really close and the coffee and food are AMAZING Next to walking trail to the aquarium but this will depend on if you like to walk. You can also rent a bike. Cons. Courtyard facing room on the top floor. This was supposed to be quieter but the noise from the street was loud most of the night. The glass on the sliding door must be really thin. You can hear everything cars bars music people shouting etc. This did not work for us. it is unreasonable. They need to upgrade their rooms by adding some sound proof curtains so people can actually sleep during their stay. Once we moved to the full bed farthest away from the window there were double beds the noise was less jarring and we fell asleep. The 19 parking fee and 20ish resort fee together seemed a bit pricey when you are only staying one night. We were excited to use the Keurig. We have one at home. Just be sure you use bottled water to fill it or your coffee will taste horrible. Their bottled water in the room costs 4 so bring your own.

Good and bad. The hotel was nice but my problem was the room was so hot. We had a courtyard room and there is no air conditioning. We were told to turn the fan on. Ask for a room away from the courtyard. Location near wharf was very nice. Restaurant was poor. Very greasy food.

Birthday Getaway. We spent the entire day walking on the piers and enjoying the ambience of the area. We saw plenty of seals sea lions and sea otters. It was in a convenient location the people were very nice and helpful and the hotel was beautiful. See above Free Wi Fi.
The room was clean and quiet with beautiful view.

Great location. We stayed in this hotel for three nights in June. The hotel was comfortable and clean. The location is great. It is an easy walk to Cannery row and the warf. We found a great bistro within walking distance. Montrio Bistro. The pool was closed due to maintenance. This should have been disclosed at the time of booking.
We did a road trip through California and stayed to visit the Monterey Bay Aquarium. You get a free and really delicious cookie at check in. Like in the most hotels breakfast is overpriced.

I do not understand. I booked the hotel despite of the higher price because of the reviews i read. The location is good because it is close to almost anything but they should anticipate hot days like this weekend 082815. They gave us 2nd level room. No AC. and since it was hot we opened windows and. the noise from the wine bar below us kept us from having a good sleep. We were haggard guests in the wedding the next day. Never again.

Seems like it was a nice hotel once. Hard to know if my somewhat negative reaction is to the Monterey vibe in general or the hotel in particular. Room was a little worn down and interiors dated particularly for the cost. We were able to book an adjoining parlor room which made our small room into a generous suite. Staff seemed less than enthusiastic but provided service as needed. Location is great if you are into Fishermans Wharf. Tourist crowd is just generally not very sophisticated. And do not get a room facing into the plaza unles you have earplugs festival outside sounds like it is happening in our second floor room. Public restrooms in lobby made me think I would never host a wedding here unles you had like your guests to have to wait in line and use a shabby bathroom.

Nice place. The hotel was easy to find for my wife and me traveling from sacramento. Upon check in the lady at the desk told us the hotel was not close to fully booked. I asked about room upgrades for a room with a view since they had several vacancies. She quickly told me it was 100 to upgrade to a harbor view. I declined and asked about a city view. She told me they have a nice quiet room on the other side of the hotel if I did not mind the distance. We did not mind. After the walk and 2 separate elevators we arrived to our room. A corner unit on the interior of the hotel. Our view was another rooms window and a concrete courtyard with no view of anything. Thanks for listening. I felt like she heard what I wanted and gave my the complete opposite. I even noticed the neighbors in the adjacent corner unit closed their blinds so they did not have to look at us either. Very frustrating. Other than that the room was comfortable. Room service is prompt. But the 35 cheese plate ended up costing 50 after fees and gratuities they included.

Impossible to rest and very low value received. Beds are comfortable Locations is near attractions. Room location right on the street with a very heavy traffic making sleeping impossible Hotel charged us 720 for a breakfast we never had. Wifi is available for a charge and its performance is poor.
Good. Room and overall facilities. Room location. It faced the street and it was too noisy.

Better Warning. Firstly the service is impeccable. Front desk is accommodating and professional all the way to housekeeping. There is construction on the convention center and that begins at 80am weekdays. Front desk notified us as we checked in but I found it unusual that the hotel did not have a letter to guests in the room. We have stayed at other hotels that DID have a letter in the room regarding nearby construction. We stayed in the last room on the 6th floor right near the construction and overlooking the lobby promenade. At 70 am on Monday morning what do we hear. The gardening blower. Calling down to front desk they said Well it must be the city. They do that sometimes. So if it is the city that is NOT a positive mark toward tourism but grateful they keep the promenade clean. it is also used as a delivery alley so walkers in the promenade beware of your surroundings. The delivery trucks zip through at a good clip. Otherwise the room for a sleepover was very comfortable. I had come back but ask for a quieter room.

Good. excellent buffet breakfast. Location could hardly be better. Considered the noise from road and construction work next door before allocating rooms. Warn customers that if you have to allocate rooms where you can here noise you customer at time of booking. Our room was changed Thank you and as it was a weekend work stopped at 4 pm on Friday.

Very nice stay. In a few words amicable good location good amenities pool is nice but would be nicer if it was not accessed right next to a parking garage. Rooms are lovely has a somewhat luxurious feel to it huge showers great beds good a c fridge wifi everything you had expect. The valet parking was a joke the valets were next to useless were not overly friendly and always expected big tips for doing nothing. Overall great recommended stay.

Nice hotel within downtown Monterey. My cousin booked this hotel for us to stay for his wedding before and after. The pros Spacious room Huge TV screen with available movies paid. Nice bathroom Good locationThe cons. Rooms are not easy to locate I got lost twice haha. maze like there is an ongoing construction within the area so roads got narrower traffic. Parking attendant did not tell us our parking is free if we show our room key we paid twice as we we are travelling back and forth to the wedding location You can jump balconies from one room to another. I think this can be a security risk. Free wifi is available only at the lobby area. Wifi in rooms are paid. Overall it is not a bad stay for me and the wedding party. We had a nice sleep and had a great stay throughout the wedding.

Bit overpriced Friendly staff. Parking multi story connected to hotel. Beds comfy but not full size queens more like 34. Nice updated bathrooms with excellent large showers. Tea Coffee machine and a small fridge. Safe in the room. We had 2 connecting rooms which we requested in advance great. did not eat at hotel but location is great nice restaurants on wharf 5 mins from hotel and 15 20 mins nice walk to Cannery Row and Aquarium. Bike hire just outside and nice cycle path. No sleep right on flight path to airport and the seagulls. Plus unfortunately there is construction work going on next door that starts at 7 am no soundproofing whatsoever here. Clever photography pool is actually tiny and sad. Smaller beds in rooms than normal.

Room 278 sucks. The hotel is nice. They assured us that we should stay in a room on side of the atrium to avoid construction noises. What they did not say was there was no air conditioning in the rooms so have to open windows. There was a bar in the atrium they blasted music all night long. People in and out keeping us awake. When we walked in it felt like a sauna. I asked for a different room but all we got was two floor fans. Both nights were sleepless from noise and heat. All the fans did was rotate the sauna heat around in the room.
Near the pier. When they finish renovations it will be again a beautiful hotel. it is clean but the rug is really old. Beds are very comfortable.

Overall great experience being in Monteray. Disappointed with hotel primarily romFront desk service was excellent. great location to be able to get around town beds were very uncomfortableno AC in romsmaid service entered room despite DO NOT DISTURB sign hanging on door.

Close to Wharf. The hotel is currently dealing with construction and the driveway is not accessible. Thus one can not simply pull up to the front of the hotel and enter the lobby. Instead you will have to park in the adjacent parking garage where you have a choice of valet or self parking. Valet is pointless because you will still have to make the trek from the parking structure to the hotel. This my friend is no easy sojourn. Once you exit the parking garage you will have to traverse the busy walkway filled with tourist and locate the one and only entrance to the hotel. Imagine doing this with luggage. Not fun. Walls and windows are thin so expect to hear everything. I might give this place a second chance after the construction. I think valet should be discounted or free. A nights stay should be lower as well. The hotel is very close the Fishermans Wharf and it is a nice walk to Cannery Row. noise level.

Our stay was fabulous. Celebrated our anniversary here and we could not of had a better time. The room is very charming and the bed exceptionally comfortable. The only complaint is there is no central ac. For the cost of the room per night I would except to be able to adjust my room temp with out hearing a machine rumble all night to do so they have a very old wall mounted ac unit in each room. The other thing is the water in the sink has two temps scalding hot and ice cold. Makes it a little difficult to wash your face with those temps. The food at this hotel is fantastic they have so much to choose from the location is also prime. You can go anywhere you want with in 5 minutes of leaving the hotel. Side note when we checked in there was a complimentary bottle of champagne waiting. I spoke to a very kind man named Dilion before I checked in and he helped set that up to surprise my girlfriend. The little touches were so great. It would have been nice to have central heat and air. The rooms here are gorgeous but come with a hefty price tag I would expect for the cost that they would offer some nice cold ac.

Incredible stay with incredible staff. From the minute we arrived the staff was beyond gracious helpful even the bellman were fabulous and helpful. The ENTIRE staff in the hotel everyone excelled beyond both our expectations. Room service unbelievable great AND the food. YUM but a lot of it. All the restaurants were incredible the pool was NOT a far walk for past posts and it was great. Make sure you are hungry when you as the are not cheap on food. you do get a lot. The bloody Marys were good. Be sure to get a bloody Mary at SCALES on the Wharf 5 at happy hour which starts at 11 am on the Wharf. Be sure to eat at Dominicos and enjoy their happy hour too. Benihanas is just in back of and left of the Hotel too great too. Everything was incredible and the room was EXCELLENT. Even the people staying there were HAPPY. It radiated joy and happiness. My only negative complaint would be they allow dogs but the dogs were behaved in the hotel. Otherwise it was a fabulous stay even on business. My wife when she left as the staff alone were unbelievably kind to her. EXCEPTIONAL Hotel and spa prices are not overpriced. It is also not a pushy overbearing place to stay either very mellow staff who seem to definitely love their job and it shows. I give it a definite 5 stars. No pets.
Very nice lobby and friendly staff. The room was a little dated but very clean. Great location.

I arrived a day late. They ended up charging me for that day and double the price for the same hotel room the next day. There were plenty of rooms available in the hotel. It was an honest mistake on my part and I felt something could have been worked out.
The property is a great location. Rates are outrageously over priced hotel looks old. room was clean but needs updating. Nothing memorable about the hotel.

Wonderful. Loved the location. Beautiful facility. Not very insulated for sound. Woke up to a baby crying in the room around the corner at 545 am. Heard someone else coughing about 20 minutes later and then a motorcycle about 12 hour later. It was loud enough you would have thought that we had our windows open. The night before people coming down the hall after midnight were very loud and there was not a problem hearing them either. If the rooms were more insulated that would be nice.

Great hotel in good location. Warm cookie at check in does nt sound like much but it was delicious and very welcome. I personally liked being near fishermans wharf free museums and there are sea lions feet off the beach out the back side of the hotel. Beds pillows and shower all great. Room 528 I think and though it was looking out at a street it was very quiet. Many restaurant choices on site. Full buffet Breakfast for 20 was very good incl omelette station. Fire pits out the back are a nice social space.

Very Good. Locatoin of hotel is very good close to restaurants parks and walks. On check in they took an extra US 50 per day on my card which would be reimbursed on check out if not used but this was not explained. It was only when I looked at the payment on my card I saw the charge was more than I expected so had to go back to check in desk to find out what the additional US 200 on my card was for. On check out they processed the correct payment which showed up on my card immediately. It was then reversed two days later and took another few days before the payment was processed again not sure what is going on with their accounts department.

Location is amazing. Great location lots to do. The valet parking personnel let the hotel down. The rest of the staff were amazing these guys were rude u helpful not just to us but several guests. This aside a great stop.
Good. Location beautiful room okay. No real personal touches.
